title: MS AccessMonthName()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessMonthName()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the name of the month based on a number:
SELECT MonthName(3);
Definition and Usage
The MonthName() function returns the name of the month based on a number.
Syntax
MonthName(
number
,
abbreviate
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A value from 1 to 12, that represent the month
abbreviate
Optional. A Boolean value. True = the month name should be abbreviated. False 
    = the month name should not be abbreviated. False is default
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return the abbreviated name of the month based on a number:
SELECT WeekdayName(3, true);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessMonthName()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessMonthName()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessMonthName()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
